maml:description.maml:para: This function converts EventLogRecords into human readable output.
This function converts EventLogRecords into human readable output.

maml:Description.maml:para: One or more EventLogRecord objects.
Specifies the event record type which, in turn, determines the custom type and therefore the default properties of the output.
Provide the function all group policy objects in order to have the friendly name presented in the event output. Usually, this can be set to 'Get-GPO -All'.
Using this parameter, the function will show the machine name and the current record number being processed.
Specifies the event record type which, in turn, determines the custom type and therefore the default properties of the output.
One or more EventLogRecord objects.
Provide the function all group policy objects in order to have the friendly name presented in the event output. Usually, this can be set to 'Get-GPO -All'.
Using this parameter, the function will show the machine name and the current record number being processed.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> Get-WinEvent -FilterHashTable @{ProviderName = "Service Control Manager"} -MaxEvents 5 | ConvertFrom-EventLogRecord -EventRecordType ServiceEvent

maml:description.maml:para: Queries the specific computer or group of computers for group policy processing events.
Queries the specific computer or group of computers for group policy processing events.

maml:Description.maml:para: Gets events from the event logs on the specified computer(s). Type the NetBIOS name, an Internet Protocol (IP) address, or the fully qualified domain name of the computer. The default value is the local computer.
Specifies a user account that has permission to perform this action. The default value is the current user.

Type a user name, such as User01 or Domain01\User01. Or, enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet. If you type a user name, you will be prompted for a password. If you type only the parameter name, you will be prompted for both a user name and a password.
Specifies the beginning of the time period for the event log query.
Specifies the end of the time period for the event log query.
Specifies the maximum number of events this function returns. The default is to return all the events in the logs.
Returns the events in oldest-first order. By default, events are returned in newest-first order.
Provide the function all group policy objects in order to have the friendly name presented in the event output.
Use this switch to provide the raw event log record for the function.

Gets events from the event logs on the specified computer(s). Type the NetBIOS name, an Internet Protocol (IP) address, or the fully qualified domain name of the computer. The default value is the local computer.
Specifies a user account that has permission to perform this action. The default value is the current user.

Type a user name, such as User01 or Domain01\User01. Or, enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet. If you type a user name, you will be prompted for a password. If you type only the parameter name, you will be prompted for both a user name and a password.
Specifies the end of the time period for the event log query.
Specifies the maximum number of events this function returns. The default is to return all the events in the logs.
Returns the events in oldest-first order. By default, events are returned in newest-first order.
Specifies the beginning of the time period for the event log query.
Provide the function all group policy objects in order to have the friendly name presented in the event output.
Use this switch to provide the raw event log record for the function.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will show the last 10 group policy processing events on the local system in gridview. You can then sort or enter additional criteria in the gridview.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-KMSClientEvent
ComputerName : WKSTN47.contoso.com TimeCreated : 5/7/2018 3:20:36 PM Id : 12308 Level : Information KMSHost : KMSHostPort : ClientMachineID : ClientTimestamp : ActivationStatus : Active Directory Activation has succeeded. ADActivationObjectName : Windows Server 2016 RTM ServerDatacenter;ServerStandard Volume:CSVLK ADActivationObject : CN=br549-999-607319-0,CN=Activation Objects,CN=Microsoft SPP,CN=Services,CN=Configuration,DC=contoso,DC=com CurrentActivationCount : NextActivationAttempt : LicenseStateExpiration : LicenseStateExpirationMin : ProductSkuId : 73001100-0000-1111-2222-f1d7bf300300 ProductSkuName : Windows 10 Enterprise MinActivateCount : KmsErrorCode : KmsErrorMessage :

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-KMSHostEvent -ComputerName SVR01.contoso.com -MaxEvents 10 -Oldest | Format-Table -Property ClientFqdn,ClientTimestamp,IsClientVM,LicenseState,ProductSkuName,MinActivateCount
ClientFqdn ClientTimestamp IsClientVM LicenseState ProductSkuName MinActivateCount ---------- --------------- ---------- ------------ -------------- ---------------- WKSTN27.contoso.com 4/10/2018 10:21:00 PM False Grace Period Office Standard 2016 5 WKSTN06.contoso.com 4/10/2018 10:24:00 PM False Grace Period Office Standard 2016 5 MYLAPTOP 4/10/2018 9:26:00 PM False Notifications Mode Windows 10 Enterprise 25 WKSTN63.contoso.com 4/10/2018 10:28:00 PM False Grace Period Office Standard 2013 5 vmwkstn04.contoso.com 4/10/2018 10:31:00 PM True Grace Period Windows 7 Professional 25 WKSTN68.contoso.com 4/10/2018 10:33:00 PM True Grace Period Windows 7 Professional 25 vmwkstn14.contoso.com 4/10/2018 10:33:00 PM True Grace Period Windows 7 Professional 25 WKSTN63 4/10/2018 9:34:00 PM False Grace Period Office Standard 2016 5 WKSTN63 4/10/2018 9:34:00 PM False Notifications Mode Windows 10 Enterprise 25 vmwkstn45.contoso.com 4/10/2018 10:34:00 PM True Grace Period Windows 7 Professional 25

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-LogonFailureEvent -ComputerName dc07 -MaxEvents 10 -Credential (Get-Credential) | Format-Table -Property ComputerName,TimeCreated,TargetUserName,IPAddress,IpPort,LogonMethod,Reason
ComputerName TimeCreated TargetUserName IpAddress LogonMethod Reason ------------ ----------- -------------- --------- ----------- ------ DC1.contoso.com 5/11/2018 8:39:29 PM rtorn 192.168.1.22 Undetermined logon method 0x18 DC1.contoso.com 5/11/2018 8:39:27 PM tljones 192.168.1.18 Undetermined logon method 0x18 DC1.contoso.com 5/11/2018 8:39:27 PM ftpug 192.168.1.66 Undetermined logon method 0x18 DC1.contoso.com 5/11/2018 8:39:24 PM ftpug 192.168.1.66 Undetermined logon method 0x18 DC1.contoso.com 5/11/2018 8:38:51 PM WKSTN99$ 192.168.1.9 Network Account currently disabled. DC1.contoso.com 5/11/2018 8:37:41 PM jknoxville 192.168.1.67 Undetermined logon method 0x18

maml:description.maml:para: This function returns the OperatingSystem version.
This function returns the OperatingSystem version based on the data in last EventID 6009 in the system log.

maml:Description.maml:para: Gets events from the event logs on the specified computer(s). Type the NetBIOS name, an Internet Protocol (IP) address, or the fully qualified domain name of the computer. The default value is the local computer.
Specifies a user account that has permission to perform this action. The default value is the current user.

Type a user name, such as User01 or Domain01\User01. Or, enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet. If you type a user name, you will be prompted for a password. If you type only the parameter name, you will be prompted for both a user name and a password.
Use this switch to provide the raw event log record for the function.
Return all available events.

Gets events from the event logs on the specified computer(s). Type the NetBIOS name, an Internet Protocol (IP) address, or the fully qualified domain name of the computer. The default value is the local computer.
Specifies a user account that has permission to perform this action. The default value is the current user.

Type a user name, such as User01 or Domain01\User01. Or, enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet. If you type a user name, you will be prompted for a password. If you type only the parameter name, you will be prompted for both a user name and a password.
Use this switch to provide the raw event log record for the function.
Return all available events.

command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-OSVersionFromEvent
ComputerName OperatingSystemVersion ------------ ---------------------- WKSTN07.contoso.com 10.00.17134

Filter the results by the number of pages printed.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> C:\PowerShell\Get-PrintDocumentEvent -ComputerName printsvc -MaxEvents 1 -Oldest
ComputerName : PRINTSVR TimeCreated : 10/5/2017 8:12:05 AM PrintJobId : 234 DocumentName : Print Document UserName : CONTOSO\KSmith2 ClientMachineName : WKSTN07 PrinterName : HPColorPrinter PrinterPort : IP_172.16.5.37 DocumentSizeBytes : 1557928 DocumentPageCount : 2

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-RemoteLogonEvent -ComputerName WKSTN47 -MaxEvents 5
ComputerName : WKSTN47.contoso.com TimeCreated : 5/11/2018 1:16:51 PM Id : 4625 Level : Information EventType : Logon Failure UserName : WKSTN47\GUEST IpAddress : LogonID : Reason : Account currently disabled. LogonMethod : Network
ComputerName : WKSTN47.contoso.com TimeCreated : 5/11/2018 11:15:51 AM Id : 4625 Level : Information EventType : Logon Failure UserName : CONTOSO\CARROLLD IpAddress : 127.0.0.1 LogonID : Reason : Unknown user name or bad password. LogonMethod : Interactive (local system)

maml:description.maml:para: This function will query the specified system for all service control manager events for service operations, stop, and start events. You can then filter on a particular service name or service displayname.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> (Get-ServiceEvent).Where({$_.ServiceDisplayName -match "print"}) | Select-Object -Property TimeCreated,EventType,ServiceName,ServiceDisplayName,Message
TimeCreated : 9/12/2017 9:41:27 PM EventType : ServiceOperations ServiceName : ServiceDisplayName : Printer Extensions and Notifications Message : The Printer Extensions and Notifications service is marked as an interactive service. However, the system is configured to not allow interactive services. This service may not function properly.
TimeCreated : 10/3/2017 10:42:18 PM EventType : ServiceOperations ServiceName : Spooler ServiceDisplayName : Print Spooler Message : The start type of the Print Spooler service was changed from auto start to demand start.
TimeCreated : 10/3/2017 10:42:20 PM EventType : ServiceOperations ServiceName : Spooler ServiceDisplayName : Print Spooler Message : The start type of the Print Spooler service was changed from demand start to auto start.

Gets events from the event logs on the specified computer(s). Type the NetBIOS name, an Internet Protocol (IP) address, or the fully qualified domain name of the computer. The default value is the local computer.
Specifies a user account that has permission to perform this action. The default value is the current user.

Type a user name, such as User01 or Domain01\User01. Or, enter a PSCredential object, such as one generated by the Get-Credential cmdlet. If you type a user name, you will be prompted for a password. If you type only the parameter name, you will be prompted for both a user name and a password.
Specifies the end of the time period for the event log query.
Specifies the maximum number of events this function returns. The default is to return all the events in the logs.
Returns the events in oldest-first order. By default, events are returned in newest-first order.
Specifies the beginning of the time period for the event log query.
Use this switch to provide the raw event log record for the function.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-SystemRestartEvent -MaxEvents 10 | Format-Table
ComputerName TimeCreated Id ProviderName Level Status UserName Reason Details ------------ ----------- -- ------------ ----- ------ -------- ------ ------- WKSTN07.contoso.com 5/9/2018 1:27:51 PM 6005 EventLog Information Startup WKSTN07.contoso.com 5/9/2018 1:27:51 PM 6009 EventLog Information System Info WKSTN07.contoso.com 5/9/2018 1:27:51 PM 6008 EventLog Error Unexpected Shutdown WKSTN07.contoso.com 5/7/2018 3:23:12 PM 6005 EventLog Information Startup WKSTN07.contoso.com 5/7/2018 3:23:12 PM 6009 EventLog Information System Info WKSTN07.contoso.com 5/7/2018 3:22:29 PM 6006 EventLog Information Shutdown WKSTN07.contoso.com 5/7/2018 3:22:12 PM 1074 User32 Information Shutdown Initiated CONTOSO\carrolld Other (Unplanned) RuntimeBroker.exe WKSTN07.contoso.com 5/3/2018 11:09:31 PM 6005 EventLog Information Startup WKSTN07.contoso.com 5/3/2018 11:09:31 PM 6009 EventLog Information System Info WKSTN07.contoso.com 5/3/2018 11:08:41 PM 6006 EventLog Information Shutdown

maml:description.maml:para: Creates the text string that can be used with the `New-EventFilterXml` function to filter by named EventData data.
Creates the text string that can be used with the `New-EventFilterXml` function to filter by named EventData data.

maml:Description.maml:para: The hashtable should contain UserData and/or EventData each with their own hashtable.
The hashtable should contain UserData and/or EventData each with their own hashtable.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a EventData filter for the printed document named MyDocumentName.docx.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates XML that can be used to query event logs using the `Get-WinEvent` cmdlet.
Creates XML that can be used to query event logs using the `Get-WinEvent` cmdlet.

maml:Description.maml:para: Specifies the audit level for the Security to add to the XML filter.
Specifies the end of the time period to add to the XML filter.
Specifies a string data filter generated by the `New-EventDataFilter` function.
Specifies one or more event IDs to add to the XML filter.
Specifies the event log name to add to the XML filter.
Specifies the event provider, sometimes called event source, to add to the XML filter.
Specifies the beginning of the time period for the event log query based on the given amount of time.
Specifies the beginning of the time period to add to the XML filter.
Specifies the end of the time period to add to the XML filter.
Specifies a string data filter generated by the `New-EventDataFilter` function.
Specifies one or more event IDs to add to the XML filter.
Specifies one or more event log levels to add to the XML filter.
Specifies the event log name to add to the XML filter.
Specifies the event provider, sometimes called event source, to add to the XML filter.
Specifies the beginning of the time period for the event log query based on the given amount of time.
Specifies the beginning of the time period to add to the XML filter.
Specifies the audit level for the Security to add to the XML filter.
Specifies the end of the time period to add to the XML filter.
Specifies a string data filter generated by the `New-EventDataFilter` function.
Specifies one or more event IDs to add to the XML filter.
Specifies one or more event log levels to add to the XML filter.
Specifies the event log name to add to the XML filter.
Specifies the event provider, sometimes called event source, to add to the XML filter.
Specifies the beginning of the time period for the event log query based on the given amount of time.
Specifies the beginning of the time period to add to the XML filter.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> New-EventFilterXml -LogName Application -Provider MyEventSource -Since (New-TimeSpan -Days 3) -LevelDisplayName Critical,Error <QueryList> <Query Id="0" Path="Application"> <Select Path="Application">*[System[Provider[@Name="MyEventSource"] and (Level=1 or Level=2) and TimeCreated[timediff(@SystemTime) <= 259200000]]]</Select> </Query> </QueryList>

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create an XML filter to query the Application event log with MyEventSource provider for all Critical and Error events since the last 3 days.

maml:description.maml:para: Create a new event source, also called event provider, for an event log.
Create a new event source, also called event provider, for an event log.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the event log.
The name of the new source, or provider.
The name of the event log.
The name of the new source, or provider.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Add a new source, thedavecarroll, to the Windows PowerShell event log.

maml:description.maml:para: Write an event to the given event log.
Write an event to the given event log.

maml:Description.maml:para: The name of the event log.
The provider, also called source, for the event.
The Id for the event.
The display level for the event.
An ordered hashtable, also called dictionary.
Specifies the format of the event Message property. The EventData will be converted to this format in its entirety.
An ordered hashtable, also called dictionary.
The Id for the event.
The display level for the event.
The name of the event log.
Specifies the format of the event Message property. The EventData will be converted to this format in its entirety.
The provider, also called source, for the event.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $EventData = [ordered]@{Program = 'MyProgram';ThisEvent = 'This is an event I want to track'; SomethingElse = 'I like the C64'} PS C:\> Write-WinEvent -LogName "Windows PowerShell" -Provider thedavecarroll -EventId 100 -EventType Information -EventData $EventData

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create a new informational event log entry in the "Windows PowerShell" event log with the provider of thedavecarroll.
